name: M&V Quality Principles
description: Six universal principles for evaluating M&V plan quality. Protocol-neutral best practices applicable to any rigorous M&V plan.

accuracy.name: Accuracy
accuracy.description: The M&V plan produces results that are close to the true value of savings, with known and managed uncertainty.

acc_boundary.name: Measurement boundary defined
acc_boundary.met: The measurement boundary is explicitly defined, specifying which systems, equipment, and energy flows are included and excluded.
acc_boundary.partial: A measurement boundary is implied or partially described, but not all inclusions/exclusions are explicit.
acc_boundary.not_met: No measurement boundary is defined or discernible from the plan.

acc_uncertainty.name: Uncertainty quantified
acc_uncertainty.met: Uncertainty is quantified with numerical bounds (e.g., confidence intervals, percent error) and the methodology for estimating uncertainty is described.
acc_uncertainty.partial: Uncertainty is acknowledged or discussed qualitatively but not quantified with numerical bounds.
acc_uncertainty.not_met: Uncertainty is not mentioned or addressed in the plan.

acc_residual.name: Model residual analysis documented
acc_residual.met: Model residuals or goodness-of-fit metrics (CV-RMSE, NMBE, RÂ², etc.) are specified with acceptance thresholds.
acc_residual.partial: Model fit is discussed but specific metrics or acceptance criteria are not provided.
acc_residual.not_met: No mention of model residuals, goodness-of-fit, or model validation.

acc_calibration.name: Instrument accuracy and calibration
acc_calibration.met: Instrument accuracy classes are specified and calibration schedules or standards are documented.
acc_calibration.partial: Instruments are mentioned but accuracy classes or calibration requirements are incomplete.
acc_calibration.not_met: No discussion of instrument accuracy or calibration.

acc_data_sufficiency.name: Data sufficiency justified
acc_data_sufficiency.met: The plan justifies the amount of data collected (duration, frequency, sample size) relative to the analysis requirements.
acc_data_sufficiency.partial: Data collection is described but the sufficiency of the data for the intended analysis is not justified.
acc_data_sufficiency.not_met: No justification for data quantity or sufficiency.

completeness.name: Completeness
completeness.description: The M&V plan accounts for all significant energy effects, including those outside the primary measure.

comp_energy_streams.name: All energy streams accounted for
comp_energy_streams.met: All relevant energy streams (electricity, gas, steam, chilled water, etc.) are identified and their treatment in the analysis is specified.
comp_energy_streams.partial: Primary energy streams are identified but secondary or auxiliary streams are not addressed.
comp_energy_streams.not_met: Energy streams are not systematically identified or accounted for.

comp_adjustments.name: Adjustments explicitly defined
comp_adjustments.met: Both routine and non-routine adjustments are explicitly defined, including triggers, methods, and responsible parties.
comp_adjustments.partial: Some adjustments are mentioned but the plan does not fully distinguish routine from non-routine or lacks detail on methods.
comp_adjustments.not_met: Adjustments are not defined or addressed.

comp_baseline_period.name: Baseline period justified
comp_baseline_period.met: The baseline period is specified with start/end dates, and the choice of period is justified (e.g., representative operations, data availability).
comp_baseline_period.partial: A baseline period is stated but the rationale for its selection is not provided.

comp_interactive.name: Interactive effects addressed
comp_interactive.met: Interactive effects between measures or systems (e.g., lighting-HVAC interactions) are explicitly identified and their treatment is described.
comp_interactive.partial: Interactive effects are acknowledged but not quantified or their treatment is vague.

comp_cost_avoidance.name: Cost vs energy savings distinguished
comp_cost_avoidance.met: The plan clearly distinguishes between energy savings (physical units) and cost avoidance (monetary), specifying how each is calculated.
comp_cost_avoidance.partial: Both energy and cost savings are mentioned but the distinction or calculation methodology is unclear.
comp_cost_avoidance.not_met: No distinction is made between energy savings and cost avoidance.

conservativeness.name: Conservativeness
conservativeness.description: When uncertainty exists, the M&V plan adopts assumptions that tend to understate rather than overstate savings.

cons_assumptions.name: Conservative assumptions documented
cons_assumptions.met: Key assumptions are documented and explicitly stated to err on the side of understating savings where uncertainty exists.
cons_assumptions.partial: Assumptions are documented but their conservative or non-conservative nature is not discussed.

cons_bias_direction.name: Bias direction stated
cons_bias_direction.met: The plan explicitly states the expected direction of bias in savings estimates and explains which party bears the risk.
cons_bias_direction.partial: Bias is acknowledged but the direction or risk allocation is not explicit.
cons_bias_direction.not_met: No discussion of bias direction or risk allocation.

cons_stipulated.name: Stipulated values justified conservatively
cons_stipulated.met: Any stipulated (assumed rather than measured) values are justified with conservative reasoning, and the impact of the stipulation on savings is bounded.
cons_stipulated.partial: Stipulated values are present with some justification but conservativeness is not explicitly demonstrated.
cons_stipulated.not_met: Stipulated values are used without justification, or conservativeness of stipulations is not addressed.

consistency.name: Consistency
consistency.description: The M&V plan applies the same methods, terms, and procedures across baseline and reporting periods.

cst_method_match.name: Methods consistent across periods
cst_method_match.met: The same measurement methods, models, and calculation procedures are applied to both baseline and reporting periods, or any changes are documented and justified.
cst_method_match.partial: Methods appear similar across periods but consistency is not explicitly confirmed or documented.
cst_method_match.not_met: Different methods are used across periods without justification, or consistency is not addressed.

cst_terminology.name: Standard M&V terminology used
cst_terminology.met: The plan uses standard M&V terminology consistently (e.g., baseline, reporting period, routine adjustments, measurement boundary).
cst_terminology.partial: Some standard terms are used but terminology is inconsistent or non-standard terms are used without definition.
cst_terminology.not_met: Terminology is non-standard or inconsistent throughout.

cst_reporting_freq.name: Reporting frequency consistent
cst_reporting_freq.met: Reporting intervals are defined and consistent with data collection frequency and contract requirements.
cst_reporting_freq.partial: Reporting frequency is mentioned but not clearly aligned with data collection or contract terms.

cst_normalization.name: Normalization applied consistently
cst_normalization.met: Normalization variables and methods are applied consistently across baseline and reporting periods.
cst_normalization.partial: Normalization is mentioned but consistency of application across periods is not confirmed.
cst_normalization.not_met: Normalization is not addressed or is applied inconsistently.

relevance.name: Relevance
relevance.description: The M&V approach is appropriate for the project's size, complexity, risk, and stakeholder needs.

rel_option_justified.name: M&V approach selection justified
rel_option_justified.met: The chosen M&V approach (e.g., Option A/B/C/D or equivalent method) is explicitly justified based on project characteristics such as measure type, risk, and cost.
rel_option_justified.partial: An M&V approach is stated but the rationale for its selection is incomplete or generic.
rel_option_justified.not_met: No justification is provided for the M&V approach selection.

rel_scope_match.name: M&V scope proportional to project
rel_scope_match.met: The M&V effort (cost, complexity, rigor) is proportional to the project's savings value and risk level.
rel_scope_match.partial: M&V scope is described but proportionality to project value/risk is not explicitly addressed.
rel_scope_match.not_met: M&V scope appears disproportionate to the project or proportionality is not discussed.

rel_ecm_coverage.name: All ECMs covered by M&V plan
rel_ecm_coverage.met: Every energy conservation measure (ECM) in the project is addressed by the M&V plan with a specified approach.
rel_ecm_coverage.partial: Most ECMs are covered but some are missing or coverage is ambiguous.
rel_ecm_coverage.not_met: Significant ECMs are not covered by the M&V plan.

rel_stakeholder.name: Stakeholder reporting needs addressed
rel_stakeholder.met: The plan identifies stakeholder reporting needs and describes how M&V results will be communicated to each audience.
rel_stakeholder.partial: Reporting is described but specific stakeholder needs are not identified or addressed.
rel_stakeholder.not_met: Stakeholder reporting needs are not discussed.

transparency.name: Transparency
transparency.description: The M&V plan provides sufficient detail for independent review and replication of results.

trans_model_spec.name: Model specification disclosed
trans_model_spec.met: The mathematical model (regression form, variables, degrees of freedom, etc.) is fully specified and documented.
trans_model_spec.partial: A modeling approach is described but the full specification (variables, functional form) is incomplete.

trans_data_cleaning.name: Data cleaning rules documented
trans_data_cleaning.met: Data screening and cleaning procedures are documented, including rules for identifying and handling outliers, missing data, and anomalies.
trans_data_cleaning.partial: Data cleaning is mentioned but specific rules or procedures are not fully documented.
trans_data_cleaning.not_met: No data cleaning procedures are documented.

trans_exclusions.name: Excluded data explained
trans_exclusions.met: Any excluded data points or periods are identified with documented rationale for exclusion.
trans_exclusions.partial: Some exclusions are noted but rationale is incomplete or not all exclusions are documented.
trans_exclusions.not_met: Data exclusions are not documented or explained.

trans_reproducibility.name: Analysis reproducible by third party
trans_reproducibility.met: Sufficient detail is provided (data sources, methods, tools, assumptions) for an independent third party to reproduce the analysis.
trans_reproducibility.partial: Some analytical details are provided but gaps would prevent full independent reproduction.
trans_reproducibility.not_met: Insufficient detail for independent reproduction of the analysis.

trans_assumptions.name: All assumptions explicitly stated
trans_assumptions.met: All key assumptions underlying the M&V analysis are explicitly listed and described.
trans_assumptions.partial: Some assumptions are stated but the list appears incomplete.
